intro: Crotalaria kirkii, commonly known as the African spurred orchid, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are typically orange or yellow in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately compound, with three to five leaflets, and it often grows in rocky or disturbed soils. Crotalaria kirkii is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
